headline: Alphabet Gets Close to Passing Microsoft in Market Cap
summary: If Alphabet keeps climbing, it might soon surpass Microsoft in total market cap for the first time in seven years.  Alphabet stock got a boost late last week after a filing showed that Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway purchased 17.8 million shares of the company during the third quarter.  On Tuesday, Alphabet launched Gemini 3, an updated version of its own large language model — offering a chance to gain some ground in the artificial intelligence arms race.

On Tuesday, Alphabet launched Gemini 3, an updated version of its own large language model — offering a chance to gain some ground in the artificial intelligence arms race.

headline: Schneider Electric seals $2.3 billion in US data centre deals to power AI boom
summary: Schneider Electric said on Wednesday it had signed new deals worth almost $2.3 billion with ​two U.S. data centre operators, as surging adoption ‌of artificial intelligence boosts infrastructure demand. At an industry event in Las Vegas, the French industrial group ‌announced a $1.9 billion partnership with privately held tech firm Switch, covering power modules and cooling systems. The second agreement, valued at $373 million and involving uninterruptible power supplies and switchgear, was signed with Texas-based Digital Realty.

raw.headline: Schneider Electric seals $2.3 billion in US data centre deals to power AI boom

At an industry event in Las Vegas, the French industrial group ‌announced a $1.9 billion partnership with privately held tech firm Switch, covering power modules and cooling systems. The second agreement, valued at $373 million and involving uninterruptible power supplies and switchgear, was signed with Texas-based Digital Realty.

headline: This $1 Billion Trump Loan For Three Mile Island Lifts S&P 500 Nuclear Giant
summary: Constellation Energy shares angled higher at Wednesday's stock market open after the Department of Energy announced late Tuesday that the S&P 500 nuclear giant's plans to restart a Three Mile Island reactor is now backed by a $1 billion Trump administration loan.  The Department of Energy loan is expected to cover much of the project's estimated $1.6 billion cost with the first advance expected to make its way to Constellation Energy in Q1 2026.  The nuclear giant first announced it will be firing back up Pennsylvania's Three Mile Island Unit 1 in September 2024 as part of a two-decade long contract with Microsoft to provide power for the tech giant's data centers.

raw.headline: This $1 Billion Trump Loan For Three Mile Island Lifts S&P 500 Nuclear Giant
raw.summary: Constellation Energy shares angled higher at Wednesday's stock market open after the Department of Energy announced late Tuesday that the S&P 500 nuclear giant's plans to restart a Three Mile Island reactor is now backed by a $1 billion Trump administration loan.  The Department of Energy loan is expected to cover much of the project's estimated $1.6 billion cost with the first advance expected to make its way to Constellation Energy in Q1 2026.  The nuclear giant first announced it will be firing back up Pennsylvania's Three Mile Island Unit 1 in September 2024 as part of a two-decade long contract with Microsoft to provide power for the tech giant's data centers.

headline: Truist names Pascal Belaud as chief AI & data officer
summary: Truist Financial Corporation (NYSE: TFC) today announced that Pascal Belaud will be the company's chief AI & data officer, starting Nov. 24. Belaud, who joins the company from a long tenure at Microsoft, will be responsible for shaping the strategic vision and execution of Truist's AI, data, and advanced automation strategy across the enterprise. He will report to Truist Chief Information Officer Steve Hagerman.

He will report to Truist Chief Information Officer Steve Hagerman.

headline: AI Weekly: Mega deals and Molière-inspired plays
summary: STORY: From multi-billion dollar deals, to plays written with AI -- this is AI Weekly. -- :: AI WeeklyMicrosoft and Nvidia have made a mega deal with Claude-maker Anthropic, featuring tens of billions of dollars of spending.It includes a $30 billion commitment by the AI company to Microsoft's cloud services, Azure. And both Nvidia and Microsoft committing up to $10 billion and $5 billion in Anthropic, respectively. The agreement brings together major players in the AI industry, with Claude being a major rival to ChatGPT.Elon Musk’s artificial-intelligence startup xAI is in advanced talks to raise $15 billion in new equity - at a valuation of $230 billion.That's according to the Wall Street Journal. The new valuation would more than double the amount disclosed in March.The startup has been rapidly scaling its data-center footprint to train more advanced models, as it tries to close the gap with OpenAI’s ChatGPT and Anthropic’s Claude. Bank of America is planning to spend $4 billion more in new technology, including AI, to boost bankers' productivity and drive revenue growth.The bank's chief technology officer said its 18,000 developers have used AI agents for the past year, with significant gains in productivity.The second-biggest U.S. lender sends AI-generated market information to its financial advisers, combined with data on clients' portfolios, so that bankers can better tailor their investment advice.Nvidia's move to use smartphone-style memory chips in its AI servers could cause server-memory prices to double by late 2026.That's according to a report published Wednesday by Counterpoint Research.Electronics supply chains worldwide have been hit by a shortage of legacy memory chips in the last two months.Manufacturers have turned their focus to high-end memory chips suited to semiconductors.Counterpoint says Nvidia's decision to reduce AI server power costs, by changing the kind of memory chip it uses, could create sudden demand that the industry is not prepared for.:: Sorbonne Universite / Theatre Moliere SorbonneAnd, scholars have teamed up with an AI collective in Paris to create a new play written in the style of the famous 17th-century playwright Moliere.Over the last three years, the team has trained the French-developed Mistral AI on Moliere's works, personal library texts, and historical documents to replicate his language and humor.A production called "The Astrologer or the False Omens" is set to debut at the Chateau de Versailles in May 2026.

raw.headline: AI Weekly: Mega deals and Molière-inspired plays
raw.summary: STORY: From multi-billion dollar deals, to plays written with AI -- this is AI Weekly. -- :: AI WeeklyMicrosoft and Nvidia have made a mega deal with Claude-maker Anthropic, featuring tens of billions of dollars of spending.It includes a $30 billion commitment by the AI company to Microsoft's cloud services, Azure. And both Nvidia and Microsoft committing up to $10 billion and $5 billion in Anthropic, respectively. The agreement brings together major players in the AI industry, with Claude being a major rival to ChatGPT.Elon Musk’s artificial-intelligence startup xAI is in advanced talks to raise $15 billion in new equity - at a valuation of $230 billion.That's according to the Wall Street Journal. The new valuation would more than double the amount disclosed in March.The startup has been rapidly scaling its data-center footprint to train more advanced models, as it tries to close the gap with OpenAI’s ChatGPT and Anthropic’s Claude. Bank of America is planning to spend $4 billion more in new technology, including AI, to boost bankers' productivity and drive revenue growth.The bank's chief technology officer said its 18,000 developers have used AI agents for the past year, with significant gains in productivity.The second-biggest U.S. lender sends AI-generated market information to its financial advisers, combined with data on clients' portfolios, so that bankers can better tailor their investment advice.Nvidia's move to use smartphone-style memory chips in its AI servers could cause server-memory prices to double by late 2026.That's according to a report published Wednesday by Counterpoint Research.Electronics supply chains worldwide have been hit by a shortage of legacy memory chips in the last two months.Manufacturers have turned their focus to high-end memory chips suited to semiconductors.Counterpoint says Nvidia's decision to reduce AI server power costs, by changing the kind of memory chip it uses, could create sudden demand that the industry is not prepared for.:: Sorbonne Universite / Theatre Moliere SorbonneAnd, scholars have teamed up with an AI collective in Paris to create a new play written in the style of the famous 17th-century playwright Moliere.Over the last three years, the team has trained the French-developed Mistral AI on Moliere's works, personal library texts, and historical documents to replicate his language and humor.A production called "The Astrologer or the False Omens" is set to debut at the Chateau de Versailles in May 2026.

headline: eMazzanti Technologies President to Be Honored As a 2025 Award Winner at Hudson County Chamber of Commerce Legends Annual Gala
summary: eMazzanti Technologies President and Co-founder Carl Mazzanti has been selected by the Hudson Chamber of Commerce to receive a 2025 Class of Legends honor. headline: Lumen Launches Defender Advanced Managed Detection and Response for Microsoft Customers
summary: DENVER, November 19, 2025--As AI and cloud adoption accelerate, so do the speed and sophistication of cyberattacks. To help organizations keep pace, Lumen Technologies (NYSE: LUMN) today announced the launch of Lumen Defender℠ Advanced Managed Detection and Response (AMDR) with Microsoft Sentinel—a fully managed, cloud-native security solution that merges Lumen’s global network intelligence with Microsoft’s leading security platform.

headline: INVENT Appoints Former Microsoft and Red Hat Executive Jim Zimmerman as Chief AI Officer
summary: INVENT, the leading platform solving for the integration and data management challenges in wealth management, announced today the appointment of Jim Zimmerman as its Chief AI Officer. Zimmerman joins Invent following a distinguished career at Microsoft and Red Hat, where he helped shape cloud, open-source, and AI strategies that transformed how enterprise developers deploy and manage technology at scale.

headline: 2U to Launch Microsoft AI Program for Global Executives on edX
summary: 2U, a global leader in education technology, today announced a collaboration with Microsoft to launch CxO Edge: Run your business on AI, a new online executive education program launching first on edX, 2U's global online learning platform, in early 2026. Introduced today at Microsoft's Ignite conference, the program helps business leaders move from AI experimentation to measurable enterprise performance.

headline: Informatica Deepens Collaboration with Microsoft to Accelerate Enterprise GenAI with Trusted Data
summary: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., November 19, 2025--Informatica, a leader in enterprise AI-powered cloud data management, today announced three strategic innovations with Microsoft. The announcement, at the Microsoft Ignite 2025 conference, showcases the integration of Informatica’s Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) platform with Microsoft Foundry, Microsoft’s enterprise-grade agentic AI platform.

headline: Sepio Becomes Eligible for Microsoft MACC - Unlocks Asset-Level Visibility via Azure Marketplace
summary: Sepio, the pioneer in hardware-asset risk management, today announced that it is now eligible under the Microsoft Azure Consumption Commitment (MACC) program via the Azure Marketplace. This enables organizations with existing MACC agreements to apply committed Microsoft Azure spend toward acquiring Sepio's innovative software-based solution, bringing deep visibility and control to IT, IoT, OT and CPS environments.

headline: Will Rubrik's (RBRK) Copilot Integration Redefine Its Competitive Edge in Enterprise Cybersecurity?
summary: On November 18, 2025, Rubrik announced Rubrik Agent Cloud will integrate with Microsoft Copilot Studio, offering enterprise customers automated agent discovery, monitoring, governance, and remediation for AI agents deployed across Microsoft 365, including OneDrive and SharePoint. This move positions Rubrik as a key enabler of secure and compliant AI agent adoption in enterprise environments, addressing increasing organizational focus on managing and safeguarding AI-driven automation at...

headline: Trump DOE gives Microsoft partner $1B loan to restart Three Mile Island reactor
summary: Constellation Energy will use the loan to refurbish a reactor it idled in 2019. Microsoft has agreed to buy the power once the facility reopens in 2028.
